result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David Lawrence Hope

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Discharge Report 10-27-2022

Defendant David Lawrence Hope in court.  Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court for David Lawrence Hope.  Attorney James Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin on behalf of Attorney Michael Staskunas. 

Case in court for a status conference.  Defense acknowledges receipt of discovery and an offer but requests additional time to review materials with client.  No objection from the State.  Case adjourned for a status conference in Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Status conference scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 10-17-2022

Defendant David Lawrence Hope in court in person.  Attorney Sylvan Jaspen appeared by video for David Lawrence Hope.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Wauwatosa PD Officer A. Herrera. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant David Lawrence Hope in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
OFF THE RECORD. Defense withdraws bail motion. Case remains calendared for preliminary hearing on 08-25-2022 at 8:30 am, Branch PE.

Defendant David Lawrence Hope in court with Attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Defendant David Lawrence Hope in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant David Lawrence Hope in court with attorney Maryann Corea.  Defendant David Lawrence Hope in custody.  Claire Louise Starling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  David Lawrence Hope appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
